name: lib/cache/cacheBase.js
CacheBase
description:
Our base Cache implementation
Extend this class with new implementations to create different cache types (in-memory, database, file system etc.)

name: _get
description: Internal implementation of Get()

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

return.description: Returns the object in the cache, or undefined if not present

name: _set
description: Internal implementation of Set()

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: object
params.description: Data to be set

name: _del
description: Internal operation to delete a key

params.name: key
params.description: Key name to delete

name: _getKeys

name: get
description: Get a cached object

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: getFullObject
params.description: Get the full cache entry, including expiry time, even if expired

params.name: force
params.description: Force set, bypassing transaction blocks

return.description: Returns the object in the cache, or undefined if not present

name: set
description: Set a key in our cache

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: ttl
params.description: How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds

params.name: force
params.description:
Force set, bypassing transaction blocks
 Can be a number or a function that will return a number
 Default 1 hour

name: wrap
description:
A helper "wrap" function that will return a cached value if present
This will call the supplied function to fetch it if the value isn't present in the cache

params.name: key
params.description: Unique key name for this cache entry

params.name: fn
params.description: Fetch function that will be called if the cache entry is not present

params.name: ttl
params.description:
How long the cache entry should last in milliseconds
 Can be a number or a function that will return a number

name: getKeys
description: Get an array of all the cached keys matching the supplied prefix

name: runTransaction
description:
Run a transaction.
All other queries are halted while this is running

params.name: keyModifierFunc
params.description: Optional function that translates incoming keys

name: blockOnPendingTransactions
description: Block if we have any pending transactions

This will call the supplied function to fetch it if the value isn't present in the cache

name: lib/configBase.js
parseConfig
description: Combine given options with environment variables

params.name: options
params.description: Incoming options

return.description: Processed configuration options

name: ConfigBase
description:
Base Config Object
Supports classes with a single argument "options"
These will be sorted into a member called "this.config" containing all the same keys

Crucially, these can also be overriden through environment variables
For example, for a config option "timeout" for class Database, this could be overriden through either:
env.THEMEPARKS_TIMEOUT (using a "global module name")
env.DATABASE_TIMEOUT (using the class name)

Classes can also add additional prefixes to the supported environment variables through:
new ClassInstance({configPrefixes: ['myCustomPrefix']});
Which would also allow env.MYCUSTOMPREFIX_TIMEOUT to be used

Note that a default value must be supplied for the environment variable to be processed
If the default value is a number, the environment variable will be cast to a number as well

name: constructor
description: A base class that can be configured through environment variables

params.name: options
params.description: Config for instantiating this object

name: lib/parks/park.js
Park
description: Base Park Object

name: constructor
description: Create a new park object

name: shutdown
description:
Call this to shutdown the park object.
This is an async call, so wait until it has resolved to continue.

name: getParkUniqueID
description: Get a globally unique ID for this park

name: getAttractions
description: Get Park Attractions

name: init
description:
Setup the park for use
Call to ensure the object has been initialised before accessing data

name: _runInit
description: Run all the internal stages of the init process

name: ensureReady
description: Awaits until park is initalised and has run at least one update.

name: cacheAttractionObject
description: Cache an attraction

params.name: attractionID
params.description: ID of the attraction to be cached

name: _buildAttractionObject
description:
Build an object representing an attraction from sourced data
This object should not contain any "state" data, just static information about the attraction

params.name: attractionID
params.description: Unique Attraction ID

return.description:
Object containing at least 'name'.
Also accepts 'type', which is an {@link attractionType}

name: _getAttractionByIDInternal
description: Get the attraction object for a given ID (skips all generation/safety checks etc,)

name: findAttractionByID
description: Get data about a attraction from its ID

params.name: attractionID
params.description: Unique Attraction ID

return.description: The attraction object for the given ID, or undefined

name: _findAttractionByID
description: Get data about a attraction from its ID

params.name: attractionID
params.description: Unique Attraction ID

return.description: The attraction object for the given ID, or undefined

name: removeAttractionTag
description: Remove a tag from a given attraction ID

name: toggleAttractionTag
description:
Set a toggle tag for an attraction.
This is different from more complex tags that expect a data structure.
Use this for tags that don't have any actual value, but are just present. Eg. FastPass as a feature.

name: setAttractionTag
description:
Set an attraction tag
Used for metadata on rides, such as location, thrill level, fastpass availability etc.

params.name: attractionID
params.description: Attraction ID to update (or the actual object)

params.name: key
params.description: Tag key to set

params.name: type
params.description: Tag type to use

params.name: value
params.description: Tag value to set

return.description: True if tag was stored successfully

name: updateAttractionState
description: Update an attraction state

params.name: attractionID
params.description: Unique Attraction ID

params.name: status
params.description: New Attraction state

name: updateAttractionQueue
description: Update the queue status for an attraction

params.name: attractionID
params.description: Attraction ID to update

params.name: queueValue
params.description:
Updated Wait Time in minutes, or null if wait time doesn't exist or isn't valid.
Set waitTime to undefined to remove this queue type from the attraction.
BoardingGroup and ReturnTime types expect an object containing queue details instead of a number

params.name: type
params.description: Type of queue to update (standup, virtual, fastpass etc.)

name: postUpdate
description: Called after each successful update, handle any clean-up or extra work here

name: update
description:
Update this park
This is automatically called for you unless disableParkUpdate is set to false

name: _runUpdate
description: Internal method to actually run our update

name: _dateRefresh
description:
Called when the park's date changes
Eg. when passing midnight in the park's local timezone
or if late opening hours finish the morning after (eg. open until 2am, will be called just after 2am)

params.name: newDate
params.description: Current Park Date

params.name: oldDate
params.description: The previous date for this park before the update (can be null if park just initialised)

name: _checkDate
description: Check if the park's "active date" has changed

name: _init
description:
Internal function
Called by init() to initialise the object

name: _postInit
description:
Internal function
Called by init() to initialise the object

name: _update
description: Update function the park object calls on interval to update internal state

name: _getOperatingHoursForDate
description:
Given a moment date, return an array of opening hours for this park, or undefined
Each entry should contain openingTime, closingTime, and type (of scheduleType)

name: getOperatingHoursForDate
description:
Get the operating hours for the supplied date
Will return undefined if the park API cannot return data for this date
(park is closed, too far in future, too far in past, etc.)

params.name: date
params.description: A momentjs object

name: _getRestaurantOperatingHoursForDate
description:
Given a moment date, return an array of opening hours for the restaurants in this park, or undefined
Ech entry should contain openingTime closingTime

name: getRestaurantOperatingHoursForDate
description: Get the restaurant operating hours for the supplied date

name: getCalendar
description:
Get Operating Calendar for this park
@return{object} Object keyed to dates in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Each date entry will contain an array of operating hours.

name: getNextOpeningTime
description:
Return the number of milliseconds until the next time the park is open.
Will return 0 if park is already open.
@return{number} Milliseconds until the park is open

name: getNextClosingTime
description: Return the number of milliseconds until closing time. Or 0 if already closed.

name: getNextOpeningTimeMomentDuration
description:
Return the time until the park is open.
@return{momentDuration} Time until park opens as a Moment Duration.
Zero if already open, or null if unable to find time

name: getActiveParkDateMoment
description:
Get the current park date, taking into consideration park hours past midnight etc.
Eg. if the park is open past midnight, return yesterday's date.
@return{moment} Park's "active date" as a Moment object

name: getActiveParkDate
description:
Get the current park date, taking into consideration park hours past midnight etc.
Eg. if the park is open past midnight, return yesterday's date.
@return{string} Date in YYYY-MM-DD format

name: getCalendarForToday
description: Get the park opening hours for today

name: getCalendarForTomorrow
description: Get the park opening hours for tomorrow

name: simpleTags

Simple tags that don't have a value entry.
Instead, these tags are either present or not.

name: validators
description: Each tag type must have a validator function to confirm the incoming tag value is correct

name: validateObjectContainsOnlyGivenKeys
description:
Given an object, validate that it only contains the given keys
Will return false if the object is missing any keys, or has additional keys not listed

name: isValidTagType
description: Is the supplied tag type supported?

name: isSimpleTagType
description: Is the given type a "simple tag" (one with no actual value)

name: isValidTag
description: Validate a tag value based on its type

params.name: key
params.description: Tag name - some tags must have a valid name

params.name: type
params.description: The type for this tag entry

params.name: value
params.description: The tag data to validate matches this tag format's data structure

name: getValidTagObject
description: Given a tag key, type, and value - parse, validate, and return the full expected tag object

params.name: key
params.description: Tag name - some tags must have a valid name

params.name: type
params.description: The type for this tag entry

params.name: value
params.description: The tag data to validate matches this tag format's data structure

return.description: The tag object to use, or undefined if it isn't valid

name: lib/parks/wdw/wdwdatabase.js
lib/parks/wdw/wdwdb.js
getEntityID
description: Given a document, return it's entity ID for the WDW database

params.name: doc
params.description: CouchDB document or a document ID

types: {"INDEX_FACILITYSTATUS": string, "INDEX_CHANNELS": string, "INDEX_ENTITIES": string, "INDEX_CHILDREN": string, "INDEX_NAMES": string, "INDEX_IDS": string}

name: IndexedWDWDB
description:
An indexed live WDW database
Replicated WDW database to local disk for fast access
While replicating, will build an in-memory index of entities for fast lookup
Options to dump database to a single file or load a snapshot for quicker database boot ups

name: constructor
description: Construct a new IndexedWDWDB object

params.name: opts
params.description: PouchDB options object

params.name: opts.remoteHost
params.description: Remote database to replicate

params.name: opts.remoteUsername
params.description: Remote database username to authenticate

params.name: opts.remotePassword
params.description: Remote database password to authenticate

params.name: opts.dbName
params.description: Local database name

params.name: opts.snapshot
params.description: File location of a snapshot to 'seed' the database during startup

params.name: opts.skipSync
params.description: Skip network replication, only use data already on disk

name: getDatabaseFilePath
description: Get the LevelDOWN database location to use

params.name: name
params.description: Database name

name: init
description: Initialise the live database, returns once finished an initial sync

name: _replicate
description: Start database replication

name: _loadAndInit
description:
Internal function
Loads and performs an initial sync on the database

name: getDumpFilename
description:
Get the filename we use for saving backups of the database to disk
Used for creating simple "snapshots" to reduce initial sync times

params.name: postfix
params.description:
Optional postfix for the filename
eg. Use postfix to generate a temporary version of a file to write to before replacing the "real" database

name: loadSnapshot
description:
Restore a database backup from disk
Perform this after running "dump()" on a previous synced database
This will help to reduce the initial sync time for large databases

params.name: snapshotFile
params.description:
File path of the snapshot to restore into the database
snapshotFile will use default saveSnapshot result location if not supplied

name: saveSnapshot
description:
Save a snapshot of this live database to disk
This will be used to "seed" the database to speed up syncs for future runs

return.description: Path to resulting database snapshot

name: _initIndexes
description:
Index initialisation
This function wraps taking care of creating our indexes once only

name: _createIndexes
description: Setup our WDW indexes

name: getIndex
description: Get the internal index object for the given index type

params.name: name
params.description: Index name (see constants.INDEX_*)

name: _createIndex
description: Create an index object to be used by this database

params.name: name
params.description: Index name

params.name: defaultIndex
params.description: Index initial object state

name: _extractEntityKeys
description:
Given a WDW document, extract key identifiable data
This is used to build a look-up index of unique document types
See ancestorIndexes for some of the keys we use
This is important so we can tell the difference between entities with the same ID, but different purposes
eg. an entity ID can have multiple documents, one for the attraction itself, one for it's wait times, etc.
These need to both be in the index under the same entity ID, but with different properties to make them distinct

params.name: doc
params.description: WDW Database Document

return.description: Index object containing important identifying data

name: _extractChannelLanguage
description: Given a WDW database document, try to return its language

return.description: Language of this document. Eg. en_intl, en_us

name: _removeFromArrayIndex
description: Remove all indexes referencing docID from the given index

name: _indexWDWDocument
description:
Add a document to the database index
Used for fast lookups of entities etc. to the correct documents

params.name: doc
params.description: CouchDB document to index

name: getDocsById
description: Get an array of documents from an array of _id

name: getEntityIndex
description:
Find search index entries by ID
If you want the actual document and not just the meta-index data, use getEntity() instead

return.description: Returns the index data for this entity ID

name: getDocChildren
description: Return an array of children document IDs for a given entity ID

name: getDocNameSearch
description:
Very rudementary text search for documents matching the incoming name.
name argument will be stripped of all non-alphanumeric characters for searching.
Will return an array of document IDs with matching name substrings.

name: getEntity
description: Search for an entity in the WDW database

params.name: id
params.description: Entity ID

params.name: filter
params.description: Filter index by field

return.description: Returns all documents for this entity ID

name: getEntityOne
description:
Search for an entity in the WDW database
Attempts to return the "best candidate" single document that matches the incoming ID

params.name: id
params.description: Entity ID

params.name: filter
params.description: Optional index filter

return.description: Returns the best candidate single document, or undefined

name: getFacilityStatus
description: Get the live facility status for a given entity ID

params.name: id
params.description: Entity ID

return.description: Facility status document, or undefined

name: getByChannel
description:
Find all documents by channel
eg. 'wdw.facilitystatus.1_0' to get all WDW facility status documents

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel ID

params.name: filter
params.description: Optional document index filter

return.description: All documents in this channel (or empty array)

name: find
description:
Return all documents in the database that match the given filter
This is a slow operation! Use sparingly!

name: subscribeToChanges
description: Subscribe to all database changes with an optional mongo-style filter

name: subscribeToChannel
description: Subscribe to all changes to a channel

name: _pluginBulkDocs
description:
Plugin function to intercept bulkDocs function
We index any WDW documents we find for easier lookup later

params.name: args
params.description: bulkDocs in

name: lib/reusePromises.js
activeFunctions
description:
Module that wraps re-using the same Promise multiple times.
This allows a function to be called multiple times before returning, but only return once.
Useful for latent network requests,
such as requesting a document from multiple sources, but only making one HTTP request.

name: findActiveFunctionIndex
description: Find the active function with these arguments

name: reusePromise
description: Reuse a function until it resolves

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to pass to the function

name: reusePromiseForever
description: Reuse a function, returning it's result forever

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to pass to the function

name: _reusePromise
description: Internal call to run a Promise once time (and optionally keep result forever)

content:
# ThemeParks.wiki Parks API

![Unit Test](https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi/workflows/Unit%20Test/badge.svg) ![Documentation Build](https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi/workflows/ESDoc/badge.svg)

[API Documentation](https://themeparks.github.io/parksapi/)

This is a backend module to fetch and query live data for themeparks. This source code powers the free-to-use API at [ThemeParks.wiki](https://themeparks.wiki)

To fetch data from the API, you should look at the client libraries:
* https://github.com/ThemeParks/ThemeParks_JavaScript
* https://github.com/ThemeParks/ThemeParks_Python

Fetching and parsing logic is provided in this source code. Most parks require some form of credentials, which are not supplied in this repo. You will need to source these yourself.

General support is available for the ThemeParks.wiki API, and not this source code (except for Sponsors with support benefits).

`test.js` contains a basic set of sanity checks and output validation, which also shows how a destination object can be accessed.

Each destination generates *entities*. Entities can be of various types:

* Destinations
  * i.e, Resorts
  * These are not called resorts to avoid confusion for parks that are not part of resorts
  * eg. Walt Disney World Resort
* Parks
  * All parks must be within a Destination entity
  * eg. Magic Kingdom
* Attraction
  * A ride / transport / etc.
  * Attraction entities must be within a Destination entity (usually also within a park, but not always)
  * eg. Pirates of the Carribean
* Resturant
  * A dining location within a destination
  * eg. Casey's Corner
* Show
  * A show / parade entity with scheduled show times
  * eg. Main Street Electrical Parade

*Entity Types Being Finalised - Destinations, Parks, and Attractions however, are well supported and unlikely to change*

## Adding Destinations

Best current documentation for this is to check out `scripts/templateDestination.js` and look at the existing supported destinations.

Setup `index.js` with your new class, and edit `test.js` to test your destination to check everything is setup correctly.

## Destinations

<!-- BEGIN_DESTINATIONS -->
* WaltDisneyWorldResort
* DisneylandResort
* DisneylandParis
* TokyoDisneyResort
* HongKongDisneyland
* ShanghaiDisneylandResort
* UniversalStudios
* UniversalOrlando
* EuropaPark
* Efteling
* Phantasialand
* SeaworldOrlando
* SeaworldSanAntonio
* SeaworldSanDiego
* AltonTowers
* ThorpePark
* ChessingtonWorldOfAdventures
* LegolandWindsor
* LegolandOrlando
* Gardaland
* PortAventuraWorld
* ParcAsterix
* Toverland
* Dollywood
* SilverDollarCity
* Plopsaland
* HolidayPark
<!-- END_DESTINATIONS -->

## Configuration

Destination objects can be configured by either passing an object of variables into the constructor, or using environment variables (the preferred way).

To use environment variables, create a file called `.env` in the working directory of your project.

Environment variables are structured as:
* Class name (upper case)
* Underscore _
* Variable name (upper case)

For example, the class `WaltDisneyWorldResort` has a `resortId` configuration variable which can be loaded through the environment variable `WALTDISNEYWORLDRESORT_RESORTID`

Some classes expose "parent scopes" to allow configuring environment variables once for a range of destinations. For example, Attractions.io's base URL can be configured once through `ATTRACTIONSIO_BASEURL` rather than configuring it identically for every destination.

Environment Variables (auto-generated):

<!-- BEGIN_ENV -->
```
WALTDISNEYWORLDRESORT_RESORTID
WALTDISNEYWORLDRESORT_RESORTSHORTCODE
WALTDISNEYWORLDRESORT_PARKIDS
WALTDISNEYWORLDRESORT_VIRTUALQUEUEURL
WALTDISNEYWORLDRESORT_GENIEDATA
```

content:
{
  "name": "@themeparks/parksapi",
  "type": "module",
  "version": "1.2.40",
  "description": "",
  "engines": {
    "npm": ">=6",
    "node": ">=14"
  },
  "main": "lib/index.js",
  "exports": {
    ".": "./lib/index.js",
    "./park": "./lib/parks/park.js",
    "./parkTypes": "./lib/parks/parkTypes.js",
    "./cache/": "./lib/cache/",
    "./cache": "./lib/cache.js",
    "./cache/scopedCache": "./lib/cache/scopedCache.js",
    "./tags": "./lib/parks/tags.js"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "test": "npm run lint && npm run mocha",
    "docs": "esdoc",
    "mocha": "mocha",
    "lint": "eslint ./lib/**/*.js",
    "lintfix": "eslint ./lib/**/*.js --fix"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi.git"
  },
  "author": "@cube",
  "license": "ISC",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/ThemeParks/parksapi#readme",
  "dependencies": {
    "ajv": "^6.12.6",
    "cheerio": "^1.0.0-rc.10",
    "dotenv": "^8.2.0",
